context: Without this inlet air prefilter, very similar levels in the ambient air and emissions were found (samples 1 and 3–4). Nearly all creek samples in June had similar dimethylsulfide concentrations. H2S emission concentrations from the polluted water surface were higher than the outside air. Thiols with low molecular weights such as ethane thiol and methane thiol could not be detected. Higher dimethylsulfide, 2-buthane thiol and H2S concentrations were found in the air in June than in September. SO2 values were also lower in September air samples. Measured data indicated that the odor generating capacity of the creeks have been reduced after domestic and industrial wastewater discharges were cut off.

llm_generation.summary: In this context, methylsulfanylmethane (dimethyl sulfide) and methane are both mentioned as thiols and volatile compounds in air samples. However, the context primarily discusses the concentrations of various sulfur compounds, including dimethyl sulfide, without establishing a direct relationship or interaction between methylsulfanylmethane and methane. Their mention appears coincidental, as they are part of a broader analysis of air quality and emissions.
